endorsements.name: Glenn Jacobs
endorsements.role: Knox County Mayor · Former WWE wrestler 'Kane'
endorsements.note: Serving as Blackburn's campaign treasurer. Major signal of East TN establishment support.

endorsements.name: Damon Hininger
endorsements.note: Was rumored as potential candidate himself. Brings private prison industry connections and Nashville business establishment.

endorsements.name: Tim Burchett
endorsements.note: Endorsed Aug 18, 2025 via WVLT interview.

endorsements.name: Chuck Fleischmann
endorsements.note: Endorsed Blackburn March 6, 2025 — one of her earliest congressional backers, months before her official campaign launch.

endorsements.name: Jimmy Duncan
endorsements.note: Endorsed Sept 16, 2025. Long-serving East TN congressman adds institutional credibility.

endorsements.name: Mark Green
endorsements.note: Retired from Congress in July 2025. His endorsement of Blackburn over fellow Republican Rose is a notable signal.

endorsements.name: Randy McNally
endorsements.note: The state's highest-ranking Republican official after the governor.

endorsements.name: Jack Johnson
endorsements.note: Endorsed at campaign launch Aug 6, 2025. Key figure in the income tax fight alongside Blackburn in the early 2000s.

endorsements.name: William Lamberth
endorsements.note: Endorsed at campaign launch Aug 6, 2025. One of the most powerful voices in the state House.

endorsements.name: Ken Yager
endorsements.role: State Senator, TN-12 · Senate Majority Caucus Chair
endorsements.note: Endorsed at campaign launch Aug 6, 2025.

endorsements.name: Bo Watson
endorsements.note: Endorsed via X post Aug 6, 2025.

endorsements.name: Weston Wamp
endorsements.note: Endorsed at campaign launch Aug 6, 2025. Highlighted Blackburn's potential as Tennessee's first female governor.

endorsements.name: 30+ State Legislators
endorsements.note: Includes House leadership (Whip Johnny Garrett, Caucus Chair Jeremy Faison, Asst. Majority Leader Mark Cochran) plus dozens of individual state reps and senators.

endorsements.name: Club for Growth PAC
endorsements.note: Endorsed Sept 2025. Blackburn is a seven-time winner of their Defender of Economic Freedom Award.

endorsements.name: 92% Tennessee Donors
endorsements.note: Rose has made his Tennessee donor base a core campaign message, contrasting with Blackburn's 22% in-state rate. No verified endorsements from elected officials as of Feb 2026.

endorsements.name: Steve Cohen
endorsements.note: Tennessee's only Democratic congressman.

endorsements.name: Tennessee Moms Demand Action
endorsements.note: Green served as statewide election lead for the organization before running.

holdouts.name: Donald Trump
holdouts.note: The biggest endorsement in the race. On Jan. 28, 2026, Trump said Tennessee is 'lucky to get Blackburn' as governor — his strongest public signal yet, though he has not issued a formal endorsement.

holdouts.name: Bill Hagerty
holdouts.note: Running for Senate re-election. Has not endorsed in the governor's race despite being Tennessee's other Republican senator alongside Blackburn.

holdouts.name: Bill Lee
holdouts.note: Term-limited. Said Aug. 13, 2025 he will not endorse anyone in the race. His position on vouchers and education makes his endorsement complicated for any candidate.

holdouts.name: Tre Hargett
holdouts.note: Opted out of running for governor in Aug. 2025. Has not endorsed in the race.

analysis.blackburn: Blackburn's endorsement coalition is historically dominant for a Republican primary. She has locked up nearly the entire TN congressional delegation, both legislative chamber leaders, 30+ state legislators, and major conservative organizations including Club for Growth PAC. Rose has not secured a single endorsement from an elected official. With Trump publicly praising Blackburn in January 2026, the institutional picture is overwhelmingly one-sided.
analysis.rose: Rose has zero endorsements from elected officials — a striking gap for a sitting congressman. Despite raising $5.5M+ through aggressive early TV advertising, his inability to win over any party leaders forces him into a pure outsider-vs-establishment dynamic. His strategy appears to bypass the endorsement game entirely and go directly to voters through advertising and his Tennessee donor base messaging.
analysis.green: The Democratic endorsement picture reflects the party's diminished statewide infrastructure in Tennessee. Green has the backing of Moms Demand Action and Rep. Steve Cohen, Tennessee's only Democratic congressman. The real question is whether national Democratic organizations or prominent Tennessee Democrats like Phil Bredesen weigh in before the primary.
